title: Animated wallpapers
content:
Creating animated wallpapers from .gif files It can be tricky to do some things in the i3wm windows manager. I have searched for a long time for a way to run gifs as an animated background. It is especially nice when you have a loop of falling rain or koi fish in a pond.
Here is what you will need:
Prerequisites:
 xwinwrap  animated_background.sh
#!/bin/sh  [ -z "$1" ] && exit killall xwinwrap sleep 0.3 xwinwrap -ov -g 1366x768+0+0 -- mpv -wid WID "$1" --no-osc --no-osd-bar --loop-file --player-operation-mode=cplayer --no-audio --panscan=1.0 --no-keepaspect --no-input-default-bindings --hwdec& Make the file executable chmod +x animated_background.sh
To run the script simply run ./animated_background.sh <path-to-gif> from the file location.
